tasks.help: kubectl controls the Kubernetes cluster manager. Find more information at: https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/kubectl/overview/.
These commands correspond to alpha features that are not enabled in Kubernetes clusters by default.

Update the annotations on one or more resources All Kubernetes objects support the ability to store additional data with the object as annotations. Annotations are key/value pairs that can be larger than labels and include arbitrary string values such as structured JSON. Tools and system extensions may use annotations to store their own data. Attempting to set an annotation that already exists will fail unless --overwrite is set. If --resource-version is specified and does not match the current resource version on the server the command will fail.Use "kubectl api-resources" for a complete list of supported resources.

properties.name: TypeName
properties.help: The type or/and name of the ressource.

properties.name: Annotations
properties.help: The annotations to set on the ressource

properties.name: All
properties.help: Select all resources, including uninitialized ones, in the namespace of the specified resource types.

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Must be "none", "server", or "client". If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

properties.name: FieldSelector
properties.help: Selector (field query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. --field-selector key1=value1,key2=value2). The server only supports a limited number of field queries per type.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: Filename, directory, or URL to files identifying the resource to update the annotation.

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process the kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: Local
properties.help: If true, annotation will NOT contact api-server but run locally.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|name|go-template|go-template-file|template|templatefile|jsonpath|jsonpath-file.

properties.name: Overwrite
properties.help: If true, allow annotations to be overwritten, otherwise reject annotation updates that overwrite existing annotations.

properties.name: Record
properties.help: Record current kubectl command in the resource annotation. If set to false, do not record the command. If set to true, record the command. If not set, default to updating the existing annotation value only if one already exists.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: ResourceVersion
properties.help: If non-empty, the annotation update will only succeed if this is the current resource-version for the object. Only valid when specifying a single resource.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: Selector (label query) to filter on, not including uninitialized ones, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. -l key1=value1,key2=value2).

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

tasks.help: Print the supported API resources on the server.

properties.name: ApiGroup
properties.help: Limit to resources in the specified API group.

properties.name: Cached
properties.help: Use the cached list of resources if available.

properties.name: Namespaced
properties.help: If false, non-namespaced resources will be returned, otherwise returning namespaced resources by default.

properties.name: NoHeaders
properties.help: When using the default or custom-column output format, don't print headers (default print headers).

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: wide|name.

properties.name: SortBy
properties.help: If non-empty, sort nodes list using specified field. The field can be either 'name' or 'kind'.

properties.name: Verbs
properties.help: Limit to resources that support the specified verbs.

tasks.help: Print the supported API versions on the server, in the form of "group/version".

Apply a configuration to a resource by filename or stdin. The resource name must be specified. This resource will be created if it doesn't exist yet. To use 'apply', always create the resource initially with either 'apply' or 'create --save-config'. JSON and YAML formats are accepted. Alpha Disclaimer: the --prune functionality is not yet complete. Do not use unless you are aware of what the current state is. See https://issues.k8s.io/34274.

properties.name: All
properties.help: Select all resources in the namespace of the specified resource types.

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: Cascade
properties.help: If true, cascade the deletion of the resources managed by this resource (e.g. Pods created by a ReplicationController).  Default true.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Must be "none", "server", or "client". If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

properties.name: FieldManager
properties.help: Name of the manager used to track field ownership.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: that contains the configuration to apply.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: If true, immediately remove resources from API and bypass graceful deletion. Note that immediate deletion of some resources may result in inconsistency or data loss and requires confirmation.

properties.name: ForceConflicts
properties.help: If true, server-side apply will force the changes against conflicts.

properties.name: GracePeriod
properties.help: Period of time in seconds given to the resource to terminate gracefully. Ignored if negative. Set to 1 for immediate shutdown. Can only be set to 0 when --force is true (force deletion).

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process a kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: OpenapiPatch
properties.help: If true, use openapi to calculate diff when the openapi presents and the resource can be found in the openapi spec. Otherwise, fall back to use baked-in types.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|name|go-template|go-template-file|template|templatefile|jsonpath|jsonpath-file.

properties.name: Overwrite
properties.help: Automatically resolve conflicts between the modified and live configuration by using values from the modified configuration.

properties.name: Prune
properties.help: Automatically delete resource objects, including the uninitialized ones, that do not appear in the configs and are created by either apply or create --save-config. Should be used with either -l or --all.

properties.name: PruneWhitelist
properties.help: Overwrite the default whitelist with <group/version/kind> for --prune.

properties.name: Record
properties.help: Record current kubectl command in the resource annotation. If set to false, do not record the command. If set to true, record the command. If not set, default to updating the existing annotation value only if one already exists.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: Selector (label query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. -l key1=value1,key2=value2).

properties.name: ServerDryRun
properties.help: If true, request will be sent to server with dry-run flag, which means the modifications won't be persisted.

properties.name: ServerSide
properties.help: If true, apply runs in the server instead of the client.

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: The length of time to wait before giving up on a delete, zero means determine a timeout from the size of the object.

properties.name: Validate
properties.help: If true, use a schema to validate the input before sending it.

properties.name: Wait
properties.help: If true, wait for resources to be gone before returning. This waits for finalizers.

tasks.help: Attach to a process that is already running inside an existing container.

properties.name: Pod
properties.help: The type or/and name of the pod.

properties.name: Container
properties.help: Container name. If omitted, the first container in the pod will be chosen.

properties.name: PodRunningTimeout
properties.help: The length of time (like 5s, 2m, or 3h, higher than zero) to wait until at least one pod is running.

properties.name: Stdin
properties.help: Pass stdin to the container.

properties.name: Tty
properties.help: Stdin is a TTY.

tasks.help: Inspect authorization.

properties.name: Subcommand
properties.help: The subcommand to run.

tasks.help: Creates an autoscaler that automatically chooses and sets the number of pods that run in a kubernetes cluster. Looks up a Deployment, ReplicaSet, StatefulSet, or ReplicationController by name and creates an autoscaler that uses the given resource as a reference. An autoscaler can automatically increase or decrease number of pods deployed within the system as needed.

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: CpuPercent
properties.help: The target average CPU utilization (represented as a percent of requested CPU) over all the pods. If it's not specified or negative, a default autoscaling policy will be used.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Must be "none", "server", or "client". If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: Filename, directory, or URL to files identifying the resource to autoscale.

properties.name: Generator
properties.help: The name of the API generator to use. Currently there is only 1 generator.

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process the kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: Max
properties.help: The upper limit for the number of pods that can be set by the autoscaler. Required.

properties.name: Min
properties.help: The lower limit for the number of pods that can be set by the autoscaler. If it's not specified or negative, the server will apply a default value.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name for the newly created object. If not specified, the name of the input resource will be used.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|name|go-template|go-template-file|template|templatefile|jsonpath|jsonpath-file.

properties.name: Record
properties.help: Record current kubectl command in the resource annotation. If set to false, do not record the command. If set to true, record the command. If not set, default to updating the existing annotation value only if one already exists.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: SaveConfig
properties.help: If true, the configuration of current object will be saved in its annotation. Otherwise, the annotation will be unchanged. This flag is useful when you want to perform kubectl apply on this object in the future.

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

tasks.help: Modify certificate resources.

properties.name: Subcommand
properties.help: The subcommand to run.

tasks.help: Display addresses of the master and services with label kubernetes.io/cluster-service=true To further debug and diagnose cluster problems, use 'kubectl cluster-info dump'.

Output shell completion code for the specified shell (bash or zsh). The shell code must be evaluated to provide interactive completion of kubectl commands.  This can be done by sourcing it from the .bash_profile. Detailed instructions on how to do this are available here: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/tools/install-kubectl/#enabling-shell-autocompletion Note for zsh users: [1] zsh completions are only supported in versions of zsh >= 5.2.

Modify kubeconfig files using subcommands like "kubectl config set current-context my-context" The loading order follows these rules:  1.  If the --kubeconfig flag is set, then only that file is loaded. The flag may only be set once and no merging takes place.  2.  If $KUBECONFIG environment variable is set, then it is used as a list of paths (normal path delimiting rules for your system). These paths are merged. When a value is modified, it is modified in the file that defines the stanza. When a value is created, it is created in the first file that exists. If no files in the chain exist, then it creates the last file in the list.  3.  Otherwise, ${HOME}/.kube/config is used and no merging takes place.

Convert config files between different API versions. Both YAML and JSON formats are accepted. The command takes filename, directory, or URL as input, and convert it into format of version specified by --output-version flag. If target version is not specified or not supported, convert to latest version. The default output will be printed to stdout in YAML format. One can use -o option to change to output destination.

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: Filename, directory, or URL to files to need to get converted.

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process the kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: Local
properties.help: If true, convert will NOT try to contact api-server but run locally.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|name|go-template|go-template-file|template|templatefile|jsonpath|jsonpath-file.

properties.name: OutputVersion
properties.help: Output the formatted object with the given group version (for ex: 'extensions/v1beta1').

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

properties.name: Validate
properties.help: If true, use a schema to validate the input before sending it.

tasks.help: Mark node as unschedulable.

properties.name: Node
properties.help: The namne of the Node.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Must be "none", "server", or "client". If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: Selector (label query) to filter on.

tasks.help: Copy files and directories to and from containers.

properties.name: SrcFileSpec
properties.help: The file specification of the source. '[namespace/]pod-name:/file/path'. for a remote file '/file/path' for a local file.

properties.name: DestFileSpec
properties.help: The file specification of the destination. '[namespace/]pod-name:/file/path'. for a remote file '/file/path' for a local file.

properties.name: Container
properties.help: Container name. If omitted, the first container in the pod will be chosen.

properties.name: NoPreserve
properties.help: The copied file/directory's ownership and permissions will not be preserved in the container.

tasks.help: Create a resource from a file or from stdin. JSON and YAML formats are accepted.

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Must be "none", "server", or "client". If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

properties.name: Edit
properties.help: Edit the API resource before creating.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: Filename, directory, or URL to files to use to create the resource.

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process the kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|name|go-template|go-template-file|template|templatefile|jsonpath|jsonpath-file.

properties.name: Raw
properties.help: Raw URI to POST to the server.  Uses the transport specified by the kubeconfig file.

properties.name: Record
properties.help: Record current kubectl command in the resource annotation. If set to false, do not record the command. If set to true, record the command. If not set, default to updating the existing annotation value only if one already exists.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: SaveConfig
properties.help: If true, the configuration of current object will be saved in its annotation. Otherwise, the annotation will be unchanged. This flag is useful when you want to perform kubectl apply on this object in the future.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: Selector (label query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. -l key1=value1,key2=value2).

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

properties.name: Validate
properties.help: If true, use a schema to validate the input before sending it.

properties.name: WindowsLineEndings
properties.help: Only relevant if --edit=true. Defaults to the line ending native to your platform.

tasks.help: Delete resources by filenames, stdin, resources and names, or by resources and label selector. JSON and YAML formats are accepted. Only one type of the arguments may be specified: filenames, resources and names, or resources and label selector. Some resources, such as pods, support graceful deletion. These resources define a default period before they are forcibly terminated (the grace period) but you may override that value with the --grace-period flag, or pass --now to set a grace-period of 1. Because these resources often represent entities in the cluster, deletion may not be acknowledged immediately. If the node hosting a pod is down or cannot reach the API server, termination may take significantly longer than the grace period. To force delete a resource, you must specify the --force flag. Note: only a subset of resources support graceful deletion. In absence of the support, --grace-period is ignored. IMPORTANT: Force deleting pods does not wait for confirmation that the pod's processes have been terminated, which can leave those processes running until the node detects the deletion and completes graceful deletion. If your processes use shared storage or talk to a remote API and depend on the name of the pod to identify themselves, force deleting those pods may result in multiple processes running on different machines using the same identification which may lead to data corruption or inconsistency. Only force delete pods when you are sure the pod is terminated, or if your application can tolerate multiple copies of the same pod running at once. Also, if you force delete pods the scheduler may place new pods on those nodes before the node has released those resources and causing those pods to be evicted immediately. Note that the delete command does NOT do resource version checks, so if someone submits an update to a resource right when you submit a delete, their update will be lost along with the rest of the resource.

properties.name: All
properties.help: Delete all resources, including uninitialized ones, in the namespace of the specified resource types.

properties.name: AllNamespaces
properties.help: If present, list the requested object(s) across all namespaces. Namespace in current context is ignored even if specified with --namespace.

properties.name: Cascade
properties.help: If true, cascade the deletion of the resources managed by this resource (e.g. Pods created by a ReplicationController).  Default true.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Must be "none", "server", or "client". If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

properties.name: FieldSelector
properties.help: Selector (field query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. --field-selector key1=value1,key2=value2). The server only supports a limited number of field queries per type.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: containing the resource to delete.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: If true, immediately remove resources from API and bypass graceful deletion. Note that immediate deletion of some resources may result in inconsistency or data loss and requires confirmation.

properties.name: GracePeriod
properties.help: Period of time in seconds given to the resource to terminate gracefully. Ignored if negative. Set to 1 for immediate shutdown. Can only be set to 0 when --force is true (force deletion).

properties.name: IgnoreNotFound
properties.help: Treat "resource not found" as a successful delete. Defaults to "true" when --all is specified.

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process a kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: Now
properties.help: If true, resources are signaled for immediate shutdown (same as --grace-period=1).

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output mode. Use "-o name" for shorter output (resource/name).

properties.name: Raw
properties.help: Raw URI to DELETE to the server.  Uses the transport specified by the kubeconfig file.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: Selector (label query) to filter on, not including uninitialized ones.

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: The length of time to wait before giving up on a delete, zero means determine a timeout from the size of the object.

properties.name: Wait
properties.help: If true, wait for resources to be gone before returning. This waits for finalizers.

tasks.help: Show details of a specific resource or group of resources Print a detailed description of the selected resources, including related resources such as events or controllers. You may select a single object by name, all objects of that type, provide a name prefix, or label selector. For example:  $ kubectl describe TYPE NAME_PREFIX   will first check for an exact match on TYPE and NAME_PREFIX. If no such resource exists, it will output details for every resource that has a name prefixed with NAME_PREFIX.Use "kubectl api-resources" for a complete list of supported resources.

properties.name: TypeName
properties.help: The type or/and name of the ressource.

properties.name: AllNamespaces
properties.help: If present, list the requested object(s) across all namespaces. Namespace in current context is ignored even if specified with --namespace.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: Filename, directory, or URL to files containing the resource to describe.

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process the kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: Selector (label query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. -l key1=value1,key2=value2).

properties.name: ShowEvents
properties.help: If true, display events related to the described object.

tasks.help: Diff configurations specified by filename or stdin between the current online configuration, and the configuration as it would be if applied. Output is always YAML. KUBECTL_EXTERNAL_DIFF environment variable can be used to select your own diff command. By default, the "diff" command available in your path will be run with "-u" (unified diff) and "-N" (treat absent files as empty) options. Exit status: 0 No differences were found. 1 Differences were found. >1 Kubectl or diff failed with an error. Note: KUBECTL_EXTERNAL_DIFF, if used, is expected to follow that convention.

properties.name: FieldManager
properties.help: Name of the manager used to track field ownership.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: Filename, directory, or URL to files contains the configuration to diff.

properties.name: ForceConflicts
properties.help: If true, server-side apply will force the changes against conflicts.

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process the kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: ServerSide
properties.help: If true, apply runs in the server instead of the client.

tasks.help: Drain node in preparation for maintenance. The given node will be marked unschedulable to prevent new pods from arriving. 'drain' evicts the pods if the APIServer supportshttp://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/disruptions/ . Otherwise, it will use normal DELETE to delete the pods. The 'drain' evicts or deletes all pods except mirror pods (which cannot be deleted through the API server).  If there are DaemonSet-managed pods, drain will not proceed without --ignore-daemonsets, and regardless it will not delete any DaemonSet-managed pods, because those pods would be immediately replaced by the DaemonSet controller, which ignores unschedulable markings.  If there are any pods that are neither mirror pods nor managed by ReplicationController, ReplicaSet, DaemonSet, StatefulSet or Job, then drain will not delete any pods unless you use --force.  --force will also allow deletion to proceed if the managing resource of one or more pods is missing. 'drain' waits for graceful termination. You should not operate on the machine until the command completes. When you are ready to put the node back into service, use kubectl uncordon, which will make the node schedulable again. http://kubernetes.io/images/docs/kubectl_drain.svg.

properties.name: DeleteLocalData
properties.help: Continue even if there are pods using emptyDir (local data that will be deleted when the node is drained).

properties.name: DisableEviction
properties.help: Force drain to use delete, even if eviction is supported. This will bypass checking PodDisruptionBudgets, use with caution.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Must be "none", "server", or "client". If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: Continue even if there are pods not managed by a ReplicationController, ReplicaSet, Job, DaemonSet or StatefulSet.

properties.name: GracePeriod
properties.help: Period of time in seconds given to each pod to terminate gracefully. If negative, the default value specified in the pod will be used.

properties.name: IgnoreDaemonsets
properties.help: Ignore DaemonSet-managed pods.

properties.name: PodSelector
properties.help: Label selector to filter pods on the node.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: Selector (label query) to filter on.

properties.name: SkipWaitForDeleteTimeout
properties.help: If pod DeletionTimestamp older than N seconds, skip waiting for the pod.  Seconds must be greater than 0 to skip.

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: The length of time to wait before giving up, zero means infinite.

tasks.help: Edit a resource from the default editor. The edit command allows you to directly edit any API resource you can retrieve via the command line tools. It will open the editor defined by your KUBE_EDITOR, or EDITOR environment variables, or fall back to 'vi' for Linux or 'notepad' for Windows. You can edit multiple objects, although changes are applied one at a time. The command accepts filenames as well as command line arguments, although the files you point to must be previously saved versions of resources. Editing is done with the API version used to fetch the resource. To edit using a specific API version, fully-qualify the resource, version, and group. The default format is YAML. To edit in JSON, specify "-o json". The flag --windows-line-endings can be used to force Windows line endings, otherwise the default for your operating system will be used. In the event an error occurs while updating, a temporary file will be created on disk that contains your unapplied changes. The most common error when updating a resource is another editor changing the resource on the server. When this occurs, you will have to apply your changes to the newer version of the resource, or update your temporary saved copy to include the latest resource version.

properties.name: TypeName
properties.help: The type or/and name of the ressource.

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: Filename, directory, or URL to files to use to edit the resource.

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process the kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|name|go-template|go-template-file|template|templatefile|jsonpath|jsonpath-file.

properties.name: OutputPatch
properties.help: Output the patch if the resource is edited.

properties.name: Record
properties.help: Record current kubectl command in the resource annotation. If set to false, do not record the command. If set to true, record the command. If not set, default to updating the existing annotation value only if one already exists.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

properties.name: Validate
properties.help: If true, use a schema to validate the input before sending it.

properties.name: WindowsLineEndings
properties.help: Defaults to the line ending native to your platform.

tasks.help: Execute a command in a container.

properties.name: PodName
properties.help: The name of the pod.

properties.name: Container
properties.help: Container name. If omitted, the first container in the pod will be chosen.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: to use to exec into the resource.

properties.name: PodRunningTimeout
properties.help: The length of time (like 5s, 2m, or 3h, higher than zero) to wait until at least one pod is running.

properties.name: Stdin
properties.help: Pass stdin to the container.

properties.name: Tty
properties.help: Stdin is a TTY.

tasks.help: List the fields for supported resources This command describes the fields associated with each supported API resource. Fields are identified via a simple JSONPath identifier:  <type>.<fieldName>[.<fieldName>]   Add the --recursive flag to display all of the fields at once without descriptions. Information about each field is retrieved from the server in OpenAPI format.Use "kubectl api-resources" for a complete list of supported resources.

properties.name: ApiVersion
properties.help: Get different explanations for particular API version.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Print the fields of fields (Currently only 1 level deep).

properties.name: Resource
properties.help: The type or/and name of the ressource.

tasks.help: Expose a resource as a new Kubernetes service. Looks up a deployment, service, replica set, replication controller or pod by name and uses the selector for that resource as the selector for a new service on the specified port. A deployment or replica set will be exposed as a service only if its selector is convertible to a selector that service supports, i.e. when the selector contains only the matchLabels component. Note that if no port is specified via --port and the exposed resource has multiple ports, all will be re-used by the new service. Also if no labels are specified, the new service will re-use the labels from the resource it exposes. Possible resources include (case insensitive): pod (po), service (svc), replicationcontroller (rc), deployment (deploy), replicaset (rs).

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: ClusterIp
properties.help: ClusterIP to be assigned to the service. Leave empty to auto-allocate, or set to 'None' to create a headless service.

properties.name: ContainerPort
properties.help: Synonym for --target-port.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Must be "none", "server", or "client". If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

properties.name: ExternalIp
properties.help: Additional external IP address (not managed by Kubernetes) to accept for the service. If this IP is routed to a node, the service can be accessed by this IP in addition to its generated service IP.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: Filename, directory, or URL to files identifying the resource to expose a service.

properties.name: Generator
properties.help: The name of the API generator to use. There are 2 generators: 'service/v1' and 'service/v2'. The only difference between them is that service port in v1 is named 'default', while it is left unnamed in v2. Default is 'service/v2'.

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process the kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: Labels
properties.help: Labels to apply to the service created by this call.

properties.name: LoadBalancerIp
properties.help: IP to assign to the LoadBalancer. If empty, an ephemeral IP will be created and used (cloud-provider specific).

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name for the newly created object.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|name|go-template|go-template-file|template|templatefile|jsonpath|jsonpath-file.

properties.name: Overrides
properties.help: An inline JSON override for the generated object. If this is non-empty, it is used to override the generated object. Requires that the object supply a valid apiVersion field.

properties.name: Port
properties.help: The port that the service should serve on. Copied from the resource being exposed, if unspecified.

properties.name: Protocol
properties.help: The network protocol for the service to be created. Default is 'TCP'.

properties.name: Record
properties.help: Record current kubectl command in the resource annotation. If set to false, do not record the command. If set to true, record the command. If not set, default to updating the existing annotation value only if one already exists.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: SaveConfig
properties.help: If true, the configuration of current object will be saved in its annotation. Otherwise, the annotation will be unchanged. This flag is useful when you want to perform kubectl apply on this object in the future.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: A label selector to use for this service. Only equality-based selector requirements are supported. If empty (the default) infer the selector from the replication controller or replica set.).

properties.name: SessionAffinity
properties.help: If non-empty, set the session affinity for the service to this; legal values: 'None', 'ClientIP'.

properties.name: TargetPort
properties.help: Name or number for the port on the container that the service should direct traffic to. Optional.

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

properties.name: Type
properties.help: Type for this service: ClusterIP, NodePort, LoadBalancer, or ExternalName. Default is 'ClusterIP'.

tasks.help: Display one or many resources Prints a table of the most important information about the specified resources. You can filter the list using a label selector and the --selector flag. If the desired resource type is namespaced you will only see results in your current namespace unless you pass --all-namespaces. Uninitialized objects are not shown unless --include-uninitialized is passed. By specifying the output as 'template' and providing a Go template as the value of the --template flag, you can filter the attributes of the fetched resources.Use "kubectl api-resources" for a complete list of supported resources.

properties.name: TypeName
properties.help: The type or/and name of the ressource.

properties.name: AllNamespaces
properties.help: If present, list the requested object(s) across all namespaces. Namespace in current context is ignored even if specified with --namespace.

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: ChunkSize
properties.help: Return large lists in chunks rather than all at once. Pass 0 to disable. This flag is beta and may change in the future.

properties.name: Export
properties.help: If true, use 'export' for the resources.  Exported resources are stripped of cluster-specific information.

properties.name: FieldSelector
properties.help: Selector (field query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. --field-selector key1=value1,key2=value2). The server only supports a limited number of field queries per type.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: Filename, directory, or URL to files identifying the resource to get from a server.

properties.name: IgnoreNotFound
properties.help: If the requested object does not exist the command will return exit code 0.

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process the kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: LabelColumns
properties.help: Accepts a comma separated list of labels that are going to be presented as columns. Names are case-sensitive. You can also use multiple flag options like -L label1 -L label2...

properties.name: NoHeaders
properties.help: When using the default or custom-column output format, don't print headers (default print headers).

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|wide|name|custom-columns=...|custom-columns-file=...|go-template=...|go-template-file=...|jsonpath=...|jsonpath-file=... See custom columns [http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/kubectl-overview/#custom-columns], golang template [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview] and jsonpath template [http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/jsonpath].

properties.name: OutputWatchEvents
properties.help: Output watch event objects when --watch or --watch-only is used. Existing objects are output as initial ADDED events.

properties.name: Raw
properties.help: Raw URI to request from the server.  Uses the transport specified by the kubeconfig file.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: Selector (label query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. -l key1=value1,key2=value2).

properties.name: ServerPrint
properties.help: If true, have the server return the appropriate table output. Supports extension APIs and CRDs.

properties.name: ShowKind
properties.help: If present, list the resource type for the requested object(s).

properties.name: ShowLabels
properties.help: When printing, show all labels as the last column (default hide labels column).

properties.name: SortBy
properties.help: If non-empty, sort list types using this field specification.  The field specification is expressed as a JSONPath expression (e.g. '{.metadata.name}'). The field in the API resource specified by this JSONPath expression must be an integer or a string.

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

properties.name: UseOpenapiPrintColumns
properties.help: If true, use x-kubernetes-print-column metadata (if present) from the OpenAPI schema for displaying a resource.

properties.name: Watch
properties.help: After listing/getting the requested object, watch for changes. Uninitialized objects are excluded if no object name is provided.

properties.name: WatchOnly
properties.help: Watch for changes to the requested object(s), without listing/getting first.

tasks.help: Print a set of API resources generated from instructions in a kustomization.yaml file. The argument must be the path to the directory containing the file, or a git repository URL with a path suffix specifying same with respect to the repository root. kubectl kustomize somedir.

Update the labels on a resource.  *  A label key and value must begin with a letter or number, and may contain letters, numbers, hyphens, dots, and underscores, up to  63 characters each.  *  Optionally, the key can begin with a DNS subdomain prefix and a single '/', like example.com/my-app  *  If --overwrite is true, then existing labels can be overwritten, otherwise attempting to overwrite a label will result in an error.  *  If --resource-version is specified, then updates will use this resource version, otherwise the existing resource-version will be used.

properties.name: TypeName
properties.help: The type or/and name of the ressource.

properties.name: Labels
properties.help: The Labels to set.

properties.name: All
properties.help: Select all resources, including uninitialized ones, in the namespace of the specified resource types.

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Must be "none", "server", or "client". If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

properties.name: FieldSelector
properties.help: Selector (field query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. --field-selector key1=value1,key2=value2). The server only supports a limited number of field queries per type.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: Filename, directory, or URL to files identifying the resource to update the labels.

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process the kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: List
properties.help: If true, display the labels for a given resource.

properties.name: Local
properties.help: If true, label will NOT contact api-server but run locally.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|name|go-template|go-template-file|template|templatefile|jsonpath|jsonpath-file.

properties.name: Overwrite
properties.help: If true, allow labels to be overwritten, otherwise reject label updates that overwrite existing labels.

properties.name: Record
properties.help: Record current kubectl command in the resource annotation. If set to false, do not record the command. If set to true, record the command. If not set, default to updating the existing annotation value only if one already exists.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: ResourceVersion
properties.help: If non-empty, the labels update will only succeed if this is the current resource-version for the object. Only valid when specifying a single resource.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: Selector (label query) to filter on, not including uninitialized ones, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. -l key1=value1,key2=value2).

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

tasks.help: Print the logs for a container in a pod or specified resource. If the pod has only one container, the container name is optional.

properties.name: TypeName
properties.help: The type or/and name of the ressource.

properties.name: AllContainers
properties.help: Get all containers' logs in the pod(s).

properties.name: Container
properties.help: Print the logs of this container.

properties.name: Follow
properties.help: Specify if the logs should be streamed.

properties.name: IgnoreErrors
properties.help: If watching / following pod logs, allow for any errors that occur to be non-fatal.

properties.name: InsecureSkipTlsVerifyBackend
properties.help: Skip verifying the identity of the kubelet that logs are requested from.  In theory, an attacker could provide invalid log content back. You might want to use this if your kubelet serving certificates have expired.

properties.name: LimitBytes
properties.help: Maximum bytes of logs to return. Defaults to no limit.

properties.name: MaxLogRequests
properties.help: Specify maximum number of concurrent logs to follow when using by a selector. Defaults to 5.

properties.name: PodRunningTimeout
properties.help: The length of time (like 5s, 2m, or 3h, higher than zero) to wait until at least one pod is running.

properties.name: Prefix
properties.help: Prefix each log line with the log source (pod name and container name).

properties.name: Previous
properties.help: If true, print the logs for the previous instance of the container in a pod if it exists.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: Selector (label query) to filter on.

properties.name: Since
properties.help: Only return logs newer than a relative duration like 5s, 2m, or 3h. Defaults to all logs. Only one of since-time / since may be used.

properties.name: SinceTime
properties.help: Only return logs after a specific date (RFC3339). Defaults to all logs. Only one of since-time / since may be used.

properties.name: Tail
properties.help: Lines of recent log file to display. Defaults to -1 with no selector, showing all log lines otherwise 10, if a selector is provided.

properties.name: Timestamps
properties.help: Include timestamps on each line in the log output.

tasks.help: Print the list of flags inherited by all commands.
Update field(s) of a resource using strategic merge patch, a JSON merge patch, or a JSON patch. JSON and YAML formats are accepted.

properties.name: TypeName
properties.help: The type or/and name of the ressource.

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Must be "none", "server", or "client". If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: Filename, directory, or URL to files identifying the resource to update.

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process the kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: Local
properties.help: If true, patch will operate on the content of the file, not the server-side resource.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|name|go-template|go-template-file|template|templatefile|jsonpath|jsonpath-file.

properties.name: Patch
properties.help: The patch to be applied to the resource JSON file.

properties.name: Record
properties.help: Record current kubectl command in the resource annotation. If set to false, do not record the command. If set to true, record the command. If not set, default to updating the existing annotation value only if one already exists.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

properties.name: Type
properties.help: The type of patch being provided; one of [json merge strategic].

tasks.help: Provides utilities for interacting with plugins. Plugins provide extended functionality that is not part of the major command-line distribution. Please refer to the documentation and examples for more information about how write your own plugins. The easiest way to discover and install plugins is via the kubernetes sub-project krew. To install krew, visithttps://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/krew/#installation.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the plugin.

tasks.help: Forward one or more local ports to a pod. This command requires the node to have 'socat' installed. Use resource type/name such as deployment/mydeployment to select a pod. Resource type defaults to 'pod' if omitted. If there are multiple pods matching the criteria, a pod will be selected automatically. The forwarding session ends when the selected pod terminates, and rerun of the command is needed to resume forwarding.

properties.name: TypeName
properties.help: The type or/and name of the ressource.

properties.name: Ports
properties.help: The port combinations to forward. In the Format 'srcPort:destPort'.

properties.name: Address
properties.help: Addresses to listen on (comma separated). Only accepts IP addresses or localhost as a value. When localhost is supplied, kubectl will try to bind on both 127.0.0.1 and ::1 and will fail if neither of these addresses are available to bind.

properties.name: PodRunningTimeout
properties.help: The length of time (like 5s, 2m, or 3h, higher than zero) to wait until at least one pod is running.

tasks.help: Creates a proxy server or application-level gateway between localhost and the Kubernetes API Server. It also allows serving static content over specified HTTP path. All incoming data enters through one port and gets forwarded to the remote kubernetes API Server port, except for the path matching the static content path.

properties.name: AcceptHosts
properties.help: Regular expression for hosts that the proxy should accept.

properties.name: AcceptPaths
properties.help: Regular expression for paths that the proxy should accept.

properties.name: Address
properties.help: The IP address on which to serve on.

properties.name: ApiPrefix
properties.help: Prefix to serve the proxied API under.

properties.name: DisableFilter
properties.help: If true, disable request filtering in the proxy. This is dangerous, and can leave you vulnerable to XSRF attacks, when used with an accessible port.

properties.name: Keepalive
properties.help: keepalive specifies the keep-alive period for an active network connection. Set to 0 to disable keepalive.

properties.name: Port
properties.help: The port on which to run the proxy. Set to 0 to pick a random port.

properties.name: RejectMethods
properties.help: Regular expression for HTTP methods that the proxy should reject (example --reject-methods='POST,PUT,PATCH'). .

properties.name: RejectPaths
properties.help: Regular expression for paths that the proxy should reject. Paths specified here will be rejected even accepted by --accept-paths.

properties.name: UnixSocket
properties.help: Unix socket on which to run the proxy.

properties.name: Www
properties.help: Also serve static files from the given directory under the specified prefix.

properties.name: WwwPrefix
properties.help: Prefix to serve static files under, if static file directory is specified.

tasks.help: Replace a resource by filename or stdin. JSON and YAML formats are accepted. If replacing an existing resource, the complete resource spec must be provided. This can be obtained by  $ kubectl get TYPE NAME -o yaml.

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: Cascade
properties.help: If true, cascade the deletion of the resources managed by this resource (e.g. Pods created by a ReplicationController).  Default true.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Must be "none", "server", or "client". If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: to use to replace the resource.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: If true, immediately remove resources from API and bypass graceful deletion. Note that immediate deletion of some resources may result in inconsistency or data loss and requires confirmation.

properties.name: GracePeriod
properties.help: Period of time in seconds given to the resource to terminate gracefully. Ignored if negative. Set to 1 for immediate shutdown. Can only be set to 0 when --force is true (force deletion).

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process a kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|name|go-template|go-template-file|template|templatefile|jsonpath|jsonpath-file.

properties.name: Raw
properties.help: Raw URI to PUT to the server.  Uses the transport specified by the kubeconfig file.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: SaveConfig
properties.help: If true, the configuration of current object will be saved in its annotation. Otherwise, the annotation will be unchanged. This flag is useful when you want to perform kubectl apply on this object in the future.

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: The length of time to wait before giving up on a delete, zero means determine a timeout from the size of the object.

properties.name: Validate
properties.help: If true, use a schema to validate the input before sending it.

properties.name: Wait
properties.help: If true, wait for resources to be gone before returning. This waits for finalizers.

tasks.help: Manage the rollout of a resource.   Valid resource types include:  *  deployments  *  daemonsets  *  statefulsets.

properties.name: Subcommand
properties.help: The subcommand to run.

tasks.help: Create and run a particular image in a pod.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the container.

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: Attach
properties.help: If true, wait for the Pod to start running, and then attach to the Pod as if 'kubectl attach ...' were called.  Default false, unless '-i/--stdin' is set, in which case the default is true. With '--restart=Never' the exit code of the container process is returned.

properties.name: Cascade
properties.help: If true, cascade the deletion of the resources managed by this resource (e.g. Pods created by a ReplicationController).  Default true.

properties.name: Command
properties.help: If true and extra arguments are present, use them as the 'command' field in the container, rather than the 'args' field which is the default.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Must be "none", "server", or "client". If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

properties.name: Env
properties.help: Environment variables to set in the container.

properties.name: Expose
properties.help: If true, service is created for the container(s) which are run.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: to use to replace the resource.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: If true, immediately remove resources from API and bypass graceful deletion. Note that immediate deletion of some resources may result in inconsistency or data loss and requires confirmation.

properties.name: Generator
properties.help: The name of the API generator to use, see http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/kubectl-conventions/#generators for a list.

properties.name: GracePeriod
properties.help: Period of time in seconds given to the resource to terminate gracefully. Ignored if negative. Set to 1 for immediate shutdown. Can only be set to 0 when --force is true (force deletion).

properties.name: Hostport
properties.help: The host port mapping for the container port. To demonstrate a single-machine container.

properties.name: Image
properties.help: The image for the container to run.

properties.name: ImagePullPolicy
properties.help: The image pull policy for the container. If left empty, this value will not be specified by the client and defaulted by the server.

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process a kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: Labels
properties.help: Comma separated labels to apply to the pod(s). Will override previous values.

properties.name: LeaveStdinOpen
properties.help: If the pod is started in interactive mode or with stdin, leave stdin open after the first attach completes. By default, stdin will be closed after the first attach completes.

properties.name: Limits
properties.help: The resource requirement limits for this container.  For example, 'cpu=200m,memory=512Mi'.  Note that server side components may assign limits depending on the server configuration, such as limit ranges.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|name|go-template|go-template-file|template|templatefile|jsonpath|jsonpath-file.

properties.name: Overrides
properties.help: An inline JSON override for the generated object. If this is non-empty, it is used to override the generated object. Requires that the object supply a valid apiVersion field.

properties.name: PodRunningTimeout
properties.help: The length of time (like 5s, 2m, or 3h, higher than zero) to wait until at least one pod is running.

properties.name: Port
properties.help: The port that this container exposes.

properties.name: Quiet
properties.help: If true, suppress prompt messages.

properties.name: Record
properties.help: Record current kubectl command in the resource annotation. If set to false, do not record the command. If set to true, record the command. If not set, default to updating the existing annotation value only if one already exists.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: Replicas
properties.help: Number of replicas to create for this container. Default is 1.

properties.name: Requests
properties.help: The resource requirement requests for this container.  For example, 'cpu=100m,memory=256Mi'.  Note that server side components may assign requests depending on the server configuration, such as limit ranges.

properties.name: Restart
properties.help: The restart policy for this Pod.  Legal values [Always, OnFailure, Never].  If set to 'Always' a deployment is created, if set to 'OnFailure' a job is created, if set to 'Never', a regular pod is created. For the latter two --replicas must be 1.  Default 'Always', for CronJobs `Never`.

properties.name: Rm
properties.help: If true, delete resources created in this command for attached containers.

properties.name: SaveConfig
properties.help: If true, the configuration of current object will be saved in its annotation. Otherwise, the annotation will be unchanged. This flag is useful when you want to perform kubectl apply on this object in the future.

properties.name: Schedule
properties.help: A schedule in the Cron format the job should be run with.

properties.name: ServiceGenerator
properties.help: The name of the generator to use for creating a service.  Only used if --expose is true.

properties.name: ServiceOverrides
properties.help: An inline JSON override for the generated service object. If this is non-empty, it is used to override the generated object. Requires that the object supply a valid apiVersion field.  Only used if --expose is true.

properties.name: Serviceaccount
properties.help: Service account to set in the pod spec.

properties.name: Stdin
properties.help: Keep stdin open on the container(s) in the pod, even if nothing is attached.

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: The length of time to wait before giving up on a delete, zero means determine a timeout from the size of the object.

properties.name: Tty
properties.help: Allocated a TTY for each container in the pod.

properties.name: Wait
properties.help: If true, wait for resources to be gone before returning. This waits for finalizers.

tasks.help: Set a new size for a Deployment, ReplicaSet, Replication Controller, or StatefulSet. Scale also allows users to specify one or more preconditions for the scale action. If --current-replicas or --resource-version is specified, it is validated before the scale is attempted, and it is guaranteed that the precondition holds true when the scale is sent to the server.

properties.name: All
properties.help: Select all resources in the namespace of the specified resource types.

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: CurrentReplicas
properties.help: Precondition for current size. Requires that the current size of the resource match this value in order to scale.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: Filename, directory, or URL to files identifying the resource to set a new size.

properties.name: Kustomize
properties.help: Process the kustomization directory. This flag can't be used together with -f or -R.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|name|go-template|go-template-file|template|templatefile|jsonpath|jsonpath-file.

properties.name: Record
properties.help: Record current kubectl command in the resource annotation. If set to false, do not record the command. If set to true, record the command. If not set, default to updating the existing annotation value only if one already exists.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: Replicas
properties.help: The new desired number of replicas. Required.

properties.name: ResourceVersion
properties.help: Precondition for resource version. Requires that the current resource version match this value in order to scale.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: Selector (label query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. -l key1=value1,key2=value2).

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: The length of time to wait before giving up on a scale operation, zero means don't wait. Any other values should contain a corresponding time unit (e.g. 1s, 2m, 3h).

tasks.help: Configure application resources These commands help you make changes to existing application resources.

properties.name: Subcommand
properties.help: The subcommand to run.

tasks.help: Update the taints on one or more nodes.  *  A taint consists of a key, value, and effect. As an argument here, it is expressed as key=value:effect.  *  The key must begin with a letter or number, and may contain letters, numbers, hyphens, dots, and underscores, up to  253 characters.  *  Optionally, the key can begin with a DNS subdomain prefix and a single '/', like example.com/my-app  *  The value is optional. If given, it must begin with a letter or number, and may contain letters, numbers, hyphens, dots, and underscores, up to  63 characters.  *  The effect must be NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule or NoExecute.  *  Currently taint can only apply to node.

properties.name: TypeName
properties.help: The type or/and name of the ressource.

properties.name: TaintEffects
properties.help: The taint effects to set.

properties.name: All
properties.help: Select all nodes in the cluster.

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Must be "none", "server", or "client". If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|name|go-template|go-template-file|template|templatefile|jsonpath|jsonpath-file.

properties.name: Overwrite
properties.help: If true, allow taints to be overwritten, otherwise reject taint updates that overwrite existing taints.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: Selector (label query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. -l key1=value1,key2=value2).

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

properties.name: Validate
properties.help: If true, use a schema to validate the input before sending it.

tasks.help: Display Resource (CPU/Memory/Storage) usage. The top command allows you to see the resource consumption for nodes or pods. This command requires Metrics Server to be correctly configured and working on the server.
Mark node as schedulable.

properties.name: Node
properties.help: The name of the node.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Must be "none", "server", or "client". If client strategy, only print the object that would be sent, without sending it. If server strategy, submit server-side request without persisting the resource.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: Selector (label query) to filter on.

tasks.help: Print the client and server version information for the current context.

properties.name: Client
properties.help: If true, shows client version only (no server required).

properties.name: Output
properties.help: One of 'yaml' or 'json'.

properties.name: Short
properties.help: If true, print just the version number.

tasks.help: Experimental: Wait for a specific condition on one or many resources. The command takes multiple resources and waits until the specified condition is seen in the Status field of every given resource. Alternatively, the command can wait for the given set of resources to be deleted by providing the "delete" keyword as the value to the --for flag. A successful message will be printed to stdout indicating when the specified condition has been met. One can use -o option to change to output destination.

properties.name: All
properties.help: Select all resources in the namespace of the specified resource types.

properties.name: AllNamespaces
properties.help: If present, list the requested object(s) across all namespaces. Namespace in current context is ignored even if specified with --namespace.

properties.name: AllowMissingTemplateKeys
properties.help: If true, ignore any errors in templates when a field or map key is missing in the template. Only applies to golang and jsonpath output formats.

properties.name: FieldSelector
properties.help: Selector (field query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. --field-selector key1=value1,key2=value2). The server only supports a limited number of field queries per type.

properties.name: Filename
properties.help: identifying the resource.

properties.name: For
properties.help: The condition to wait on: [delete|condition=condition-name].

properties.name: Local
properties.help: If true, annotation will NOT contact api-server but run locally.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output format. One of: json|yaml|name|go-template|go-template-file|template|templatefile|jsonpath|jsonpath-file.

properties.name: Recursive
properties.help: Process the directory used in -f, --filename recursively. Useful when you want to manage related manifests organized within the same directory.

properties.name: Selector
properties.help: Selector (label query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.(e.g. -l key1=value1,key2=value2).

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template string or path to template file to use when -o=go-template, -o=go-template-file. The template format is golang templates [http://golang.org/pkg/text/template/#pkg-overview].

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: The length of time to wait before giving up.  Zero means check once and don't wait, negative means wait for a week.

properties.name: As
properties.help: Username to impersonate for the operation.

properties.name: AsGroup
properties.help: Group to impersonate for the operation, this flag can be repeated to specify multiple groups.

properties.name: CacheDir
properties.help: Default HTTP cache directory.

properties.name: CertificateAuthority
properties.help: Path to a cert file for the certificate authority.

properties.name: ClientCertificate
properties.help: Path to a client certificate file for TLS.

properties.name: ClientKey
properties.help: Path to a client key file for TLS.

properties.name: Cluster
properties.help: The name of the kubeconfig cluster to use.

properties.name: Context
properties.help: The name of the kubeconfig context to use.

properties.name: InsecureSkipTlsVerify
properties.help: If true, the server's certificate will not be checked for validity. This will make your HTTPS connections insecure.

properties.name: Kubeconfig
properties.help: Path to the kubeconfig file to use for CLI requests.

properties.name: MatchServerVersion
properties.help: Require server version to match client version.

properties.name: Namespace
properties.help: If present, the namespace scope for this CLI request.

properties.name: Password
properties.help: Password for basic authentication to the API server.

properties.name: Profile
properties.help: Name of profile to capture. One of (none|cpu|heap|goroutine|threadcreate|block|mutex).

properties.name: ProfileOutput
properties.help: Name of the file to write the profile to.

properties.name: RequestTimeout
properties.help: The length of time to wait before giving up on a single server request. Non-zero values should contain a corresponding time unit (e.g. 1s, 2m, 3h). A value of zero means don't timeout requests.

properties.name: Server
properties.help: The address and port of the Kubernetes API server.

properties.name: TlsServerName
properties.help: Server name to use for server certificate validation. If it is not provided, the hostname used to contact the server is used.

properties.name: Token
properties.help: Bearer token for authentication to the API server.

properties.name: User
properties.help: The name of the kubeconfig user to use.

properties.name: Username
properties.help: Username for basic authentication to the API server.
